alert.note: Alert for Elbert (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 4:17PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Elbert, southwestern Laurens, southeastern Anderson, Abbeville and northwestern Greenwood Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 417 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Abbeville, or 6 miles northeast of Calhoun Falls, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Belton, Honea Path, Ware Shoals, Calhoun Falls, Due West, Lake Secession, Donalds, Cokesbury and Hodges. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
